question: What does it mean when the LED display flashes yellow In Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones? Select the correct answer from A, B, C, D. Only one answer is correct. A) Battery charge is 0 % to 20 %. B) Battery charge is 90 % to 100 %. C) Battery charge is 20 % to 90 %. D) Headphones are in Bluetooth pairing mode
ground_truth: C) Battery charge is 20 % to 90 %.
answer: C) Battery charge is 20% to 90%.

question: Is it possible to setup voice prompt? If yes, how to do that in Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones?
ground_truth: Yes, it is possible. To set up the voice prompts you require the Smart Control App (>18). In the app settings, you can activate voice prompts and sound signals (also the default setting) or deactivate them.
answer: To set up voice prompts in the Sennheiser Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones, you need to use the Smart Control app. In the app settings, you can activate voice prompts and sound signals or deactivate them completely.

question: When do I replace the ear pads and where can I find the replacement ear pads for Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones?
ground_truth: There is no specific timeframe for ear pad replacement. For hygiene reasons, you should replace your ear pads from time to time. Replacement ear pads are available at www.sennheiser-hearing.com/accentum-wireless.
answer: You should replace the ear pads of the Accentum Wireless Around Ear Headphones from time to time for hygiene reasons. Replacement ear pads can be found at www.sennheiser-hearing.com/accentum-wireless for online purchase or by contacting your local Sonova Consumer Hearing partner at www.sennheiser-hearing.com/service-support.

Using the headphones
20  |  ACCENTUM
Putting the headphones on and adjusting 
the headband 
For good sound quality, the best possible noise cancellation and the 
best possible wearing comfort, the headband can be adjusted to 
properly fit your head. 
▷ Wear the headphones so that the headband runs over the top of 
your head. The markings for the right side (R) and for the left side 
(L) can be found on the inside of the ear cups.
▷ Move the ear cups up or down the headband slider until:

▷ Move the ear cups up or down the headband slider until:
– your ears are comfortably covered by the ear pads,
– you feel even, gentle pressure around your ears,
– a snug fit of the headband on the head is ensured.
For optimal sound quality, the ear pads must completely surround 
your ears.

question: What should you do to reset MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 earbuds to factory settings?

question: Why does the first ruleset disallow all access using IPv6?
ground_truth: Because MobileConnect Manager is currently only supporting IPv4
answer: The first ruleset disallows all access using IPv6 because the MobileConnect Manager currently only supports IPv4.
contexts: expect a global configuration file to be located at /etc/mcm-iptables.conf. An example file:            Please note that not every option is used in every ruleset. The second ruleset allows to add limitations for the ports used for accessing the MobileConnect Manager web interface and for the interfaces used by the MobileConnect Stations. This increases the maintenance overhead, as it needs all MAC addresses of the MobileConnect Stations and the IP addresses of the systems allowed access to the web interface to be added to the configuration file. question: What are the two modes of operation for MobileConnect, and how do they differ?
ground_truth: The two modes are Standalone Mode and Manager Mode. Standalone Mode is easier to set up with minimal IT support, focusing on audio streaming via QR codes without internet connectivity. Manager Mode offers full functionality with IT infrastructure, DNS setup, and centralized administration.
answer: The two modes of operation for MobileConnect are Standalone Mode and Manager Mode. Standalone Mode simplifies the setup and is flexible for various scenarios, while Manager Mode offers full functionality with the need for MobileConnect Manager Software and constant internet connectivity.
contexts:
2 
MobileConnect – System Modes

10 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 Two port solution  In this scenario there are two separate networks. One is used for the public devices, the other is used for control of the MobileConnect Station and access to the MobileConnect Manager web interface.  
Using two separate networks employs a clear separation between streaming and control communication, allowing for a better confinement of the user controlled mobile devices.   Wi-Fi

5 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
Standalone Mode  Standalone Mode simplifies the setup of MobileConnect. It enables a flexible solution that is applicable for a wide range of usage scenarios.

7 
MobileConnect – System Modes

8 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
Manager Mode   Manager mode offers the full range of functionality of MobileConnect. The MobileConnect Manager software is added to the setup as a single point of administration for all MobileConnect Stations in the infrastructure. With the Manager, all settings and administration can be handled from anywhere in the network.

4 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 Standalone Mode              Manager Mode                
  A decision for a mode is not final. A switch in any direction is possible at any time. In many cases it is advisable to use the Standalone Mode as entry mode for testing streaming functionality and switch to Manager Mode once the system is tested and its function has been approved.
Sennheiser MobileConnect System Modes Standalone Mode & Manager Mode

3 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 
System  Sennheiser MobileConnect allows streaming live audio content with low latency and in superior quality via WiFi to connected Android and iOS smart devices. To ensure low latency and superior audio quality, unicast is used for streaming.  Application Modes  To adapt to different application scenarios and network environments, MobileConnect can be operated in two Modes: Manager Mode and Standalone Mode.  Mode Differentiation

Manager Mode offers the full range of functions but requires the setup of the MobileConnect Manager Software and DNS entries. This Mode therefor requires IT support. Settings and administration for all MobileConnect Stations in the network can be done using the Manager as single point of administration from anywhere in the network. Manager Mode requires constant internet connectivity.

11 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 MobileConnect Stations  
• Renaming a MobileConnect Station. • Setting Station audio configuration. • Configuring Station network interfaces. • Updating software of MobileConnect Stations. • Resetting of MobileConnect Stations. • Removing a Station from the Manager.  Additionally, the Local Admin interface is available.

question: What is required for using MobileConnect in Standalone Mode?
ground_truth: An enterprise-grade router, access point(s), and a local network with DHCP enabled are required. Streams are accessed using QR codes.
answer: For using MobileConnect in Standalone Mode, you need to connect it to a network infrastructure, and it is ready to operate. Basic IT support is required, and all settings and administration are done via the Local Admin Interface. Users have to scan the QR-Code created in the Local Admin Interface to connect to streams. Internet connectivity is not required in Standalone Mode.
contexts:
5 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
Standalone Mode  Standalone Mode simplifies the setup of MobileConnect. It enables a flexible solution that is applicable for a wide range of usage scenarios.

With Standalone Mode, MobileConnect focuses on its central audio streaming function. After connecting it to a network infrastructure, it is ready to operate. Setup and installation effort are simplified in this mode, only basic IT support is required. All settings and administration are done via the Local Admin Interface. To connect to streams, users have to scan the QR-Code created in the Local Admin Interface.

In this mode, the MobileConnect Station and MobileConnect App are the system components.   Considerations  
ü Ease of installation ü Limited IT support required – Manager functionalities not available – Streams can only be accessed via QR-Code   
Setup Overview  Setting up MobileConnect in Standalone Mode requires the following steps: 
 The target application for Standalone Mode is the equipment of a single room (or multiple single rooms) with live audio streams.

Does the system require an internet connection?
Â¶


The MobileConnect system itself only requires internet connectivity when it is used in the so called âManager Modeâ because the MobileConnect Manager handles the authentication and updates over the cloud.


In âStandalone Modeâ the MobileConnect system does not require an internet connection.

In contrast to Manager Mode, internet connectivity it is not required in Standalone Mode. However, it is recommended for all MobileConnect networks. Missing internet connectivity on the network worsens user experience significantly. Mobile devices constantly try to establish internet access. If it is not available in the connected Wi-Fi, most devices will try and switch to mobile data connection. Additionally, connecting a device to a network without internet access limits its usability for

4 
MobileConnect – System Modes 
 Standalone Mode              Manager Mode                
  A decision for a mode is not final. A switch in any direction is possible at any time. In many cases it is advisable to use the Standalone Mode as entry mode for testing streaming functionality and switch to Manager Mode once the system is tested and its function has been approved.
The MobileConnect Manager requires internet connectivity in order to create and authenticate administration accounts and update connected MobileConnect Stations.

In âStandalone Modeâ the MobileConnect system does not require an internet connection.


For the end-users smartphone we recommend to offer an internet connection on the WiFi-side because some smartphones will automatically disconnect from a WiFi that is not providing internet connectivity and this will lead to audio dropouts.






Can I use my old CinemaConnect system with the new MobileConnect App?
Â¶


Yes, the MobileConnect App supports CinemaConnect systems including subtitles.
Sennheiser MobileConnect System Modes Standalone Mode & Manager Mode

Wi-Fi  
MobileConnect relies on Wi-Fi to transmit streams to connected smartphones. The quality of the Wi-Fi is directly influencing the service’s quality and performance.   
Quality of Service is recommended.  Usage of 5 GHz band is recommended.  The recommended limit of number of clients per AP is 50.  
 
The term Standalone Mode refers to the MobileConnect Station, not the network infrastructure. MobileConnect does not handle network organization.

Missing internet connectivity on the network worsens user experience significantly. Mobile devices constantly try to establish internet access. If it is not available in the connected Wi-Fi, most devices will try and switch to mobile data connection. Additionally, connecting a device to a network without internet access limits its usability for
